trans-unit.source: By default the indexer will select records from the page id where the Indexing Configuration is stored. If you want an alternative page as the source of your records you can enter it here.
index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If checked, the URL in the search result for records will be encoded with a "&cHash" parameter to make it cacheable. Use only if supported by the plugin!
index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Levels of recursion.
For file indexing it is the level of directories to decend. For External URLs it's the depth to which the crawler will go with links.
index_config:externalUrl, index_config:filepath
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The Indexed Search configuration allows you to set up indexing of resources which are external to the TYPO3 page tree. This could be a library of records (like news), a directory structure of files (like PDFs) or an external URL to be crawled to some depth - or third-party content provided from other extensions via hooks.
trans-unit.target: La configuration de la recherche indexée permet de paramétrer les sources d'indexation extérieures à l'arborescence de TYPO3. Cela peut être une librairie de contenu (comme des actualités), une structure de répertoire avec des fichiers (comme des PDFs) ou une URL externe à indexer à plusieurs niveaux de profondeurs - ou le contenu d'une application tierce provenant d'autres extensions via des hooks.

trans-unit.source: If needed, give it a description or put other important notes in this field.
trans-unit.target: Si nécessaire, indiquer une description ou d'autres notes importantes dans ce champ.

trans-unit.source: The Indexing Configuration records are used to set up how the indexing occurs, at which time and related to which part of the page tree. An important requirement to keep in mind is that the "crawler" extension must be installed since the indexing engine uses the "crawler" extensions queue as a timing device - and using the "crawler" extension means using a cron-job to activate it from the shell.
If you want to index only specific files in the directory, enter a list of file extensions here. For example: "html,pdf,doc"
trans-unit.target: SI vous souhaitez indexer seulement certains types de fichiers présent dans un dossier, entrer une liste d'extensions ici. Par exemple : "html, pdf, doc"

trans-unit.source: index_config:filepath
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Enter the URL of the external website you want to index.
trans-unit.target: Entrer l'URL du site internet externe que vous souhaitez indexer

trans-unit.source: Enter a comma-list of fields to be indexed. The first field name will be used for the search result title.
Example: "header,bodytext,image_caption" would index the Header, Bodytext and Image Caption fields from "tt_content". Notice that you must use the real database field names, don't spell them wrong!
index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Enter a filepath inside fileadmin/ where you want the files to be indexed.
Example: "fileadmin/newsletters/"
Enter the GET parameters necessary to display the search results. You can use ###UID### as a marker in the parameter template.

Notice: The GET parameters are appended to the URL of the page where the Indexing Configuration is stored (which must be the page where a plugin exists that can display the records with the given parameters!). Example value: "&showUid=###UID###"
index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Disable the configuration by this checkbox. If disabled, the configuration will be bypassed by the crawlers cron job.
trans-unit.target: Désactiver la configuration via la case à cocher. Si elle est désactivée, la configuration sera gérée par les cron jobs des robots d'indexation

trans-unit.source: Notice; Disabling the indexing process will not hide already indexed content in search results!
trans-unit.target: Remarque : Désactiver le processus d'indexation ne permettra pas de faire disparaitre de suite votre contenu indexé dans les pages de résultat !

alt-trans.target: Remarque : Désactiver le processus d'indexation ne permettra pas de faire disparaître de suite votre contenu indexé dans les pages de résultat !

trans-unit.source: index_config:starttime
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: When a search is conducted in this indexing configuration the actual search will take place in the indexed content from the configurations listed here. You can also enter pages and if you do so the search will take place in indexing configurations found on those pages.
Enter how many records to index for each instance of the indexing process (how many per minute). Default is 100 records.
trans-unit.target: Entrer le nombre d'enregistrement à indexer à chaque instance d'indexation (nombre par minute). Par défaut, le nombre est de 100 enregistrements.

trans-unit.source: index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If set, new and changed records from this table will be indexed through a hook in the core (Datahandler) meaning that they will be searchable immediately after addition to the system.
index_config:table2index
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Set a start time for the configuration. If set, the configuration will be bypassed by the crawlers cron job until this time is reached.
index_config:hidden
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Specify the database table to index records from.
trans-unit.target: Spécifier les tables de la base de données à indexer

trans-unit.source: Use this setting to adjust how often you would like a re-indexing process to run for the configuration.
trans-unit.target: utiliser ces paramètres pour ajuster la fréquence d’exécution de votre processus de ré-indexation

trans-unit.source: index_config:timer_next_indexing, index_config:timer_offset
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This field contains the date and time of the next occurring indexing session. If left blank the next indexing will occur as soon as the cron-script is run again (typically within the next minute) and afterwards set to the next time according to frequency and offset.
trans-unit.target: Ce champ contient la date et l'heure de la prochaine indexation. Si champ vide, la prochaine indexation se fera dés que le script de cron sera de nouveau exécuté (typiquement, à la prochaine minute) et après la prochaine indexation se fera selon la fréquence.

trans-unit.source: index_config:timer_offset, index_config:timer_frequency
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The offset adjusts at what time of day you want the indexing process to run.
trans-unit.target: Ce paramètre ajuste à quelle heure de la journée vous souhaitez lancer le processus d'indexation

trans-unit.source: index_config:timer_frequency
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Provide a title for the configuration.
trans-unit.target: Donner un titre à la configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select the type of Indexing Configuration here.
trans-unit.target: Sélectionner le type de configuration d'indexation ici

trans-unit.source: Records - You will be able to index records on a specified page from a specified database table. You can determine which fields from that record you want to index and how additional GET parameters should look like when linking to the search result. Files - Allows you to index a whole directory of files from the fileadmin/ folder. You can optionally specify how many levels of recursion you want. External URL - Allows you to index an external site and search it from your TYPO3 installation! You can specify how deep the crawler should go on that external URL. Page tree - Allows you to index the page tree using the cron script. This type will not be useful as a category for searching like the other types. Meta configuration - Points to a collection of other indexing configurations in which the search will be done. Cannot be used for cron-job based indexing. Custom - Other extensions might register custom types of configurations.
Enter a URL on each line inside of which the crawler should not decend.

Example: If you wish to index "https://typo3.org/" but not "https://typo3.org/extensions/" and "https://typo3.org/downloads/" then you simply enter those two URLs into the box like this:
https://typo3.org/downloads/ https://typo3.org/extensions/
trans-unit.target:
Exemple: Si vous souhaitez indexer "http://typo3.org/" sans "http://typo3.org/extensions/" et sans "http://typo3.org/downloads/", alors entrer simplement ces deux URLs dans le champ comme ceci:
http://typo3.org/downloads/ http://typo3.org/extensions/

trans-unit.source: index_config:externalUrl
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
